But how does one take the first step? That is the question. In this video, we'll go through the basic controls and keybindings of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition to teach you how to take that first step on your endless adventures into the Overworld. || Teaches [[player movement]]s, [[sprint]]ing, navigating [[inventory]], dropping an [[item]], changing [[control]]s, and more.

|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmcr9RQEwss YouTube] || [[File:How to Prepare For the Night.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Prepare For the Night || In Minecraft, it's not just the stars that come out at night. This video will show you how to prepare for your first spooky night in the Overworld. || Teaches the player to prepare for the [[nighttime]] by crafting a [[wooden sword]] and [[wooden pickaxe|pickaxe]], scavenging for [[food]], and building a [[shelter]].
|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ql_d0ofJimw YouTube] || [[File:How to Survive the First Night.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Survive the First Night || Slumber parties might be really fun, but not if you bunk with zombies and creepers. So, when night comes, make sure to prevent any unexpected visitors. Let's take a look at how to secure your newly built home and how you can survive the first night. || Teaches the player to survive the night. Block entrances using [[door|doors]], craft a [[bed]] to [[sleep]] in the night, and torches to lighten up the interior. Eat food to [[regenerate]] health. In the nighttime, you can craft items, organize your inventory, and plan for tomorrow.
|}

|-

| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdndAhvBCiI YouTube] || [[File:How to Build the Basics.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Build the Basics || Rome wasn't built in a day, and neither will your Minecraft house if you don't know how. So put on your hardhats, because today we will learn the basics of Minecraft construction — the art of turning simple blocks into architectural masterpieces. || You can plan what you build or just let your creativity begin. There are a lot of blocks, all of them have different properties.
|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O_9m4KelNpU YouTube] || [[File:How to Tame and Breed Animals.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Tame and Breed Animals || Animal lover? The Overworld is filled with furry friends to tame and call your own. Best of all, they won't chew up your shoes as their real-life counterparts! In this video, we will show you how to obtain a little feathered or four-legged companion and how to take care of them. || You can tame wolves, ocelots, horses, and parrots. To tame wolves use bones, for ocelotss use fish, keep mounting horses to tame them. Wheat can be fed to cows and sheep, seeds to chicken, and carrots to pigs to breed them.
|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Jzdz6lPcr0 YouTube] || [[File:How to Build a Simple Farm.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Build a Simple Farm || The person who said, "Your soul is a garden," definitely never knew how frustrating gardening can be if you don't have the know-how... or maybe they did? Nevertheless, it is time to paint those thumbs green because, in this video, we will go through the basics of Minecraft farming. || Farms are essentials to get food. Use a hoe to create farmland nearby water sources. Get seeds by breaking grass or find other crops in different places. Plant them in the farmland to grow them.
|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XmCyRq6htqU YouTube] || [[File:How to Discover Different Biomes Part 1.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Discover Different Biomes Part 1 || The world of Minecraft is mind-bogglingly large — like really, really, really big. In this video, we will do a quick run-through of the different variations of climates and environments that the Overworld has to offer – let's explore the biomes of Minecraft. || There are a lot of [[biomes]] in the ''Minecraft'' world. In every biome there are a lot of different resources, as well as different dimensions (The [[End]] and the [[Nether]] which are accessible through portals.).
|-
| [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vkeo_KjVGCk YouTube] || [[File:How to Discover Different Biomes Part 2.jpg|frameless]] || How to: Discover Different Biomes Part 2 || Ready to go beyond green forests and sandy beaches? Well, pack your bags explorers, it is time to discover the more uncharted biomes of the Overworld. From the barren yet colorful badlands to the brutally cold but still breathtakingly beautiful ice spikes, today we will go through the less common biomes you might encounter in your travels. || [[Mushroom fields]] contain a lot of mushrooms and there are no hostile mobs. In the [[Badlands]] there is [[terracotta]] and [[coal]]. In [[Ice Spikes]], large amounts of ice spikes will generate.
